benchmark_details.name: VarBench (Variable Benchmarking for Language Models)
benchmark_details.overview: VarBench is a dynamic benchmark designed to mitigate data contamination issues in language model evaluations by variabilizing existing datasets. It uses a variable perturbation technique to create new test cases, thus providing a more accurate assessment of language models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a more robust evaluation framework for language models by addressing issues of data contamination in existing benchmarks through dynamic variable perturbation.

data.source: GSM8K, Commonsense QA, Truthful QA, ARC
data.size: Variable based on the number of test cases generated for each benchmark

methodology.calculation: Performance is assessed based on the accuracy of language models on newly generated test cases compared to original benchmarks.
methodology.interpretation: Lower accuracy on VarBench than on original benchmarks indicates potential data contamination effects.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparative accuracy results on original versus perturbed benchmarks.
methodology.validation: Validated through human verification of generated test cases.
